snippet: Researchers using a remote-controlled vehicle that dived about 8,000 feet below the ocean near Antarctica have discovered 23 new animal species.
abstract: Dr Alex Rogers of the University of Oxford in England is among marine biologists reporting in journal PLoS Biology on the discovery of 23 new animal species living in the hot, dark environment around hydrothermal vents in deep-sea waters near Antarctica.
lead_paragraph: Researchers using a remote-controlled vehicle that dived about 8,000 feet below the ocean near Antarctica have discovered 23 new animal species.

headline.print_headline: A Deep-Sea Ecosystem Unlike Any Other
headline.seo: New Ecosystem Is Found Around Southern Ocean Hydrothermal Vent
headline.main: A Deep-Sea Ecosystem Unlike Any Other
